programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/16/2023. Eva Longoria visits the northeastern state of Nuevo Leon, bordering her home state of Texas. As little grows there, and with meat on every menu, inventive and resourceful chefs transform simple ingredients into culinary delights.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/23/2023. Eva Longoria visits the state of Jalisco, where much of what is seen is quintessentially ‘Mexican’ originated. She also discovers that the state capital, Guadalajara, boasts some of the country’s most cutting-edge restaurants.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/30/2023. Eva Longoria explores the port gateway between Mexico and the rest of the world, Veracruz, and discovers that in its people remains a defiant spirit, still evident in their character, music, and the bold flavors of their food.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 3/26/2023. Mexico City is one of the world’s emerging food destinations, and it’s also Eva Longoria’s second home. Longoria takes us to some of her favorite eating spots, but in this constantly evolving city, there is always more to explore.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/2/2023. In the jungles of Yucatán State, on the eastern edge of Mexico, Longoria explores the home of the ancient Maya, where a fierce pride in that ancestry still permeates every custom and dish, even in the most innovative kitchens.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/9/2023. Travelling to the mountains of Southern Mexico, Longoria discovers the hidden magic of Oaxaca that boasts some of the finest ingredients in Mexico, including chocolate, corn, tomatoes and the much-loved quesillo cheese.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/16/2023. Eva Longoria visits the northeastern state of Nuevo Leon, bordering her home state of Texas. As little grows there, and with meat on every menu, inventive and resourceful chefs transform simple ingredients into culinary delights.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 06/08/2014. A look at the dance/martial art of Capoeira, Bahia, the "African heart of Brazil," and Salvadoran fishing neighborhoods.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 9/27/2015. Bourdain explores Cuba from its bustling capital city Havana, to the slower paced, music mecca Santiago.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 10/04/2015. Bourdain and travel companion chef Eric Ripert visit France’s oldest city to experience its stew of cultures and cuisines.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 04/13/2014. Anthony Bourdain soaks up all Amritsar has to offer. Go with him as he samples savory delicacies at roadside restaurants and experiences a Gurpurab festival.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 04/20/2014. Anthony Bourdain travels to Las Vegas with food author Michael Ruhlman, where they explore sites including Huntridge Tavern.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 09/28/14. Anthony Bourdain explores Shanghai by savoring home-style cuisine and having meaningful conversations with locals about the culture and the booming economy.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 10/05/14. Anthony Bourdain explores the diverse cuisines and cultures The Bronx, New York, has to offer, by experiencing firsthand the music, food and art

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 10/12/14. Dive into Anthony Bourdain’s puzzling family history, as he takes a trip to Paraguay and experiences the rich culture and savory local dishes.

programme.title: See It Loud: The History of Black Television
programme.desc: Aired 7/9/2023. A look back at the legendary Black sitcoms that shaped the childhoods and inspired the futures of generations of viewers.

programme.title: See It Loud: The History of Black Television
programme.desc: Aired 7/16/2023. Standup and sketch comedy have always been at the center of the Black television experience. Through laughter, these programs offered audiences an escape from harsh realities and altered the comedic landscape in the process.

programme.title: See It Loud: The History of Black Television
programme.desc: Aired 7/23/2023. Black performers and creators are responsible for some of the most innovative work in the history of dramatic television. By pushing the genre's boundaries, these shows have transformed our conversations, thinking, and culture as a whole.

programme.title: See It Loud: The History of Black Television
programme.desc: Aired 7/30/2023. An exploration of how reality, talk, and competition series became showcases for authentic Black voices, talent, and culture.

programme.title: See It Loud: The History of Black Television
programme.desc: Aired 8/6/2023. Black representation in genres like superheroes, science fiction, and horror continues to evolve as pioneering voices have emerged and asserted themselves into a future of limitless imagination.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 10/19/14. Travel with Anthony Bourdain as he gives an inside look at the Dong Ba market, Vinh Moc tunnels, Duyen Anh’s restaurant and the Citadel.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 09/28/14. Anthony Bourdain explores Shanghai by savoring home-style cuisine and having meaningful conversations with locals about the culture and the booming economy.
